name: Brian May Treble Booster
notes: Brian May's treble booster into Vox AC30 setup. Stacked harmonics with bright, cutting tone and wide stereo positioning for orchestral guitar layers.

name: David Gilmour Big Muff
notes: Gilmour's sustaining lead tone. Big Muff Pi fuzz into Hiwatt amp simulation with smooth compression for singing sustain and long plate reverb.

name: Jack White Garage Fuzz
notes: Jack White's lo-fi garage attack. Searing octave fuzz with tight cabinet response, no reverb for raw, unprocessed garage rock aggression.

name: Jimi Hendrix Fuzz Face
notes: Hendrix's Fuzz Face into Marshall stack. Extreme asymmetric germanium fuzz with wah-influenced midrange scoop and controlled feedback sustain.

name: Jimmy Page Marshall Crunch
notes: Page's Marshall Superlead crunch. Les Paul into cranked Marshall stack at volume 10, producing hard asymmetric clipping with tight room ambience.

name: John Frusciante Funk DS-2
notes: Frusciante's clean funk compression with DS-2 leads. CE-1 chorus for texture, heavy compression for percussive funk attack, smooth DS-2 drive for solos.

name: Jonny Greenwood Shredmaster
notes: Greenwood's shimmering clean to aggressive distortion. Marshall Shredmaster into Fender Twin Reverb, contrasting ethereal cleans with harsh, aggressive drive.

name: Kevin Shields MBV Wash
notes: Kevin Shields' reverse reverb wash with extreme tremolo bar modulation and infinite sustain. Hall reverb with maximum decay and heavy modulation for shoegaze texture.

name: Kurt Cobain DS-1 Twin
notes: Cobain's DS-1 into Twin Reverb setup. Scooped mids with aggressive hard clipping for grunge, chorus on clean for ethereal textures.

name: Stevie Ray Vaughan Tube Screamer
notes: SRV's Tube Screamer into Fender Vibroverb. Mid-focused boost with soft clipping, slight tremolo, and dynamics that respond to his heavy pick attack.

name: The Edge U2 Delay
notes: The Edge's signature dotted-eighth delay shimmer. Vox AC30 warmth with Memory Man delay timing. Clean boost for leads, minimal saturation.

name: Tom Morello Rage Whammy
notes: Morello's whammy-influenced extreme tones. Hard clipping with tight delay, no reverb for precision effects work and radical pitch manipulation sounds.
